wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Hildred Christie (26 March 1927 – 11 October 2017) was a doctor and rower who represented Great Britain  rowing at the 1948 Summer Olympics and twice won Silver Goblets at Henley Royal Regatta.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1948 Summer Olympics

response: * Tom Christie (born 1927), English rower and doctor

Butcher was educated at Cambridge University and rowed for Cambridge in the Boat Race in 1947. He became a member of Thames Rowing Club. He competed at the 1948 Summer Olympics in the coxless fours.Sport Reference Olympic Athletes – Tony Butcher Butcher recalled that at these post-war austerity Olympics, his kit was made by his mother from terry towelling.The Sunday Times 11 May 2008 The Austerity Olympics: When the Games Came to London in 1948 by Janie Hampton In 1949 he won the Silver Goblets at Henley, partnering Tom Christie.Henley Royal Regatta Results of Final Races 1946–2003 At the 1950 British Empire Games he was a member of the English eight which won bronze medal.
Thomas or Tom Christie may also refer to:
*Tom Christie (rugby union) (born 1998), New Zealand rugby union player

response: Clack competed at the 1952 Summer Olympics in Helsinki with the men's coxless four where they came fourth. He represented England and won a silver medal in the coxless pairs with Tom Christie at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Vancouver, Canada.
